alert.note: Alert for Jones (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 1:43PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Jones County through 215 PM EDT... At 142 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was centered near Gray, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Gray, Postell, James, Bradley, Mountain Springs, Griswoldville, Haddock, Greenberry Crossroads and Clinton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
